Detailed Description

A PHP library of helpful string manipulation methods. This class does not need to be assigned to an object, as you could use the :: access method, such as Strings::isString to access them statically

Member Function Documentation

abusiveLanguage (   $string,
  $swear 
)

abusive language filter, replaces bad words in a string with '****'

Parameters
string$stringstring of text
array$swearthe array of swear words to eliminate
Returns
string the same input string is redisplayed with the curse words removed

static num_comma (   $value)
static

This function takes a numeric value, and adds commas where applicable. If you gave it the value of "2930829523", then it would return "2,930,829,523"

Author
tyuty.nosp@m.u1@v.nosp@m.odafo.nosp@m.ne.h.nosp@m.u
Parameters
int$value
Returns
string

static prependNum (   $num)
static

takes a string of numbers and, for those numbers <10, adds '0' to them. i.e. '1' becomes '01'. Useful when making dates

static strBytes (   $str)
static

Count the number of bytes of a given string. Input string is expected to be ASCII or UTF-8 encoded. Warning: the function doesn't return the number of chars in the string, but the number of bytes.

Parameters
string$strThe string to compute number of bytes
Returns
int The length in bytes of the given string.

static strPad (   $string,
  $num = 2,
  $padString = ' ',
  $type = STR_PAD_BOTH 
)
static

this version of PHP's built-in str_pad is modified to add white space around words By default it is set to add 1 space in front of and behind the string, though this method can be used just like the native str_pad, with one exception: the 2nd parameter, $num, is meant to serve as how many extra chars are to be added, whereas the native str_pad's 2nd param is how long the final string is

Parameters
$string
int$num
string$padString
int$type
Returns
string
static subWhenBlank (   $str,
  $len = 1,
  $sub = '--' 
)
static

Replaces a blank string with a different string. Used to make stuff more user-friendly, rather than just showing nothing (which is how a blank string looks) we'd show something that represents blankness

Parameters
$str
int$len

static trimLink (   $link,
  $limit = 50 
)
static

does a fancy truncate on a link so it doesn't b0rk anything i.e. http://www.example.com/reallylonglinkishere.html becomes something like http://www.example.com/r...here.html

Parameters
string$linkthe link
int$limitthe number of characters allowed
Returns
string the same input string is returned, shortened
